Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different habitats, showing land areas like a playground, garden, or forest, and water areas like ponds or streams.
The student can include various types of living plants in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, and bushes.
The student can include various types of animals in each habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams.
The student can organize and label the different living things in each habitat to show diversity.
The student can demonstrate patterns by comparing different habitats, showing how some living things are found in specific types of environments.
